entry.et: Middle English bras, from Old English bræs; akin to Middle Low German bras metal

def.dt: :an alloy consisting essentially of copper and zinc in variable proportions
:the brass instruments of an orchestra or band often used in plural
:persons in high positions (as in a business or the government)
:a band consisting chiefly or solely of brass and percussion instruments
:a conservative Democrat especially in the south who votes the straight Democratic ticket

entry.et: from the gold braid worn on the cap

def.dt: :any of a group of wind instruments (as a French horn, trombone, trumpet, or tuba) that is usually characterized by a long cylindrical or conical metal tube commonly curved two or more times and ending in a flared bell, that produces tones by the vibrations of the player's lips against a usually cup-shaped mouthpiece, and that usually has valves or a slide by which the player may produce all the tones within the instrument's range

entry.fl: noun plural but singular or plural in construction

def.dt: :details of immediate practical importance usually used in the phrase get down to brass tacks
